sourcesContent:
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react'; import axios from 'axios'; const Details =()=> { const [productData, setProductData] = useState([]); useEffect(() => { axios .get(`http://localhost:5120/api/Product`) .then((result) => { // Update image URLs to contain only the file name const modifiedData = result.data.map((product) => { const fileName = product.imageUrl.split('\\').pop(); // Adjust for other platforms if needed return { ...product, imageUrl: fileName }; }); setProductData(modifiedData); }) .catch((error) => { console.log(error); }); }, []); return (
{productData.map((product) =>

{product.title}

by {product.author}

)}
Back to home
@Model.Product.Category.Name
ISBN : @Model.Product.ISBN
List Price: @Model.Product.ListPrice.ToString("c")
Quantity
1-50
51-100
100+
Price
@Model.Product.Price.ToString("c")
@Model.Product.Price50.ToString("c")
@Model.Product.Price100.ToString("c")

@Html.Raw(Model.Product.Description)

Count
) } export default Details
